website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, inexpensive and useful multi-tool to have with you on a ride.
pros: Helpful tools for changing flats and other repairs on the road
Slimmer profile than some on the market
16 total functions including screwdrivers and hex keys
cons: Comes with tire pry rods that are plastic and a hex wrench, but neither are part of the multi-tool

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for a quality tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago, but waited to review it until I had the opportunity to use it a few times. This is a solid tool that has enough features to give me peace of mind when I'm out on my bike. I was a little dubious of the tire prys, which looked wimpy and smaller than others I've used. But after using them three times now (I had an unlucky spell this summer) I can say that they are actually pretty great, and their slim profile makes them easier to tuck into a bag than some of the wider versions. This is an overall fantastic value
customer_reviews.author: KatieBirdTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tool to do minor repairs on my bike. It has enough components to do anything I need to do for adjustments or repairs. While the size feels a little bulky, it has no problem fitting in to the nooks and crannies of my particular bike. (I have a trek mountain bike). I keep it in my saddle bag underneath my seat, so if I encounter a problem I have access to my tools on the trail. It also does not take up too much space. It's nice.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stubbs

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Really inexpensive, really high quality, and it has all the basic tools you need to work on your bike. I used it to install several bike components and do a routine tune up and I was very impressed with this tool, I bought another one immediately. Highly recommended. Edit Dec. 4, 2018 almost two years of use and these are still my go-to bike tool. Can't recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Good portable took kit for out on your bike
customer_reviews.text: Good portable tool kit to carry on your bike. If you are working on or building bikes regularly I would invest in the tools separately that are a little easier to handle repeatedly. This kit is a great size to carry though and it will save you for quick adjustments out on your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tools in a small package. Must have for any distance rider. I've luckily only had to use them a couple of times, but it worked great. The plastic tire hooks dont stay together like they're supposed to, but it really doesn't matter.. because they work. Changed a flat in under 5 min with this little kit.
customer_reviews.author: BurleyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Essential!
customer_reviews.text: Useful multi-purpose tool! Holds together well (year or so) and has all the right sizes to work on most things for our household of bikes (road single speed, hybrid 7-speed, and 7-speed tandem). Body holds together well (has separate tool to keep tight), is ok to grip (for its size and intentions, it works as well as any can be expected, really), and the metal tool pieces themselves seem to be made of a good material that has not broken or stripped yet. Absolute necessity if you have a bike!
customer_reviews.author: Paul N. RobinsonTop Contributor: Classic Rock

customer_reviews.title: Wheel nut tool too thin to give any leverage
customer_reviews.text: Well my first attempt to use this tool was very disappointing. I bought it with the sole intention of using it to remove the training wheels from my daughter’s bike after we’ve ridden to the park with the training wheels on, for her to then practice without the training wheels. Upon trying to use the tool to loosen the nuts I found the tool completely useless. While the part that should be able to loosen the nuts fits, it’s location makes it impossible to get any decent leverage to be able to actually loosen the nuts. All it did was gouge marks into the nuts and then slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart richards

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had known about their other kit
customer_reviews.text: For 33 cents more (as of today) I noticed, by googling Wotow (seller) that they have this tool kit plus tire levers plus tube patches plus nice case. Wish I had known that. This tool arrived with a little card that has some offers like a seat bag for half price, but I’m not sure how you get that. When I googled I saw the other kit. Boo. This one seems fine, like everyone says. But mine will be in a baggie and not the nice case.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nony MooseTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This tool is great. I am a novice to bikes and repairing things on them by myself and this was incredibly useful when changing a tire tube! I will certainly keep this on me when I bike to fix little things that may go wrong. It is compact enough and seems to be well made. I haven't used everything yet though it looks like it will hold up just fine. I am very pleased with my purchase and am glad that I don't have to buy several loose items because I have this Swiss Army knife of bike tools!
customer_reviews.author: MurphsLaw

customer_reviews.title: Lever broke, seller wont communicate.
customer_reviews.text: Before I even got my bike tire off the lever bent back and was unusable. I tried contacting the seller, but I still haven't seen a reply. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Matt N.

customer_reviews.title: Tool doesn't fit my hex heads due to poor design
customer_reviews.text: The hex fittings are cheaply welded. At the bottom of the hex tool some of them have a small metal lip as if they were pushed flat. This lip causes the hex tool not to fit into the hex screws on my bike. This renders the tool useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Disfunctional
customer_reviews.text: The tire tools have sharp edges. I popped two straight tubes with them. On the third tube one of the tire tools snapped. Ironically the hex wrenches on the multitool have rounded edges and tend to slip out of place. The sockets have a rounded locking beads on them but there is no crevace in the socket wrench for them to sit so the sockets slip off easily. All in all very poorly designed products.
customer_reviews.author: yefrem

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't even unscrew a bolt without bending
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday and was excited to try it. My son's bike tire has been flat for a few days and we love our evening bike rides! I opened it right up and tried it out. I couldn't even loosen the bolt holding the tire on. This tool has a little metal lip that catches the "wrench" so it locks into position. But instead of loosening the bolt, it instead bent the metal lip causing my hand to get pinched in the tool. It's nice to have the little allen wrenches for things and the tire pry bars are great. But the multi-function tool is very cheap and I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple cycling wrench for my saddle bag because I lost my old one. This one seemed like a good choice. Unfortunately it is much larger and heavier than my previous one and has quite a few tools that are completely unnecessary for cycling. Don’t buy it because if you only need a few Alan wrenches it is going to weigh way too much and take up way too much space in your saddle bag.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: I was able to fix my flat pretty quickly. This tool was pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It has all the tools you need for a quick fix. I used it to fix a flat on my bike. At first, was checking the known brands for tire-repair/multi-tool combo but ended up getting this along with a SportyGorilla mini-pump AND the AmazonBasics saddlebag. Anyway, I was able to fix my flat pretty quickly. This tool was pretty sturdy, and the quality reminded me of an old Swiss Army knife I had.
customer_reviews.author: Muttface

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for on the road fixes.
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this tool includes all the basic screw, key and bolt types that you find on a bike. It's like a Swiss army knife. The tire removal tools are just a cherry on the cake. The product is well made, and really does address all the standard size stuff that you can loosen and tighten. I keep this in my under saddle bag when we go riding. It is small and compact and has just the stuff that I might need in an emergency. Absolutely the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Lange

customer_reviews.title: No need to ride a bike to appreciate this versatile small tool
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple little tool to keep in the automobile glove compartment just for emergencies. I didn't want a full on tool box, just the ability to tighten a loose screw or a wonkey bolt. And this absolutely fills the bill. Just drop it in the glove compartment and you have a cheap and cheerful solution to simple mechanical issues. In fact, when my battery died, I used this tool to remove the battery terminals. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Jack

customer_reviews.title: An Unusual Cycling Multi-Tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool is as unique in its way as the Topeak Alien was in its debut. The WOTOW is a compact metric toolbox with Allen keys, sockets, and wrenches. It lacks a chain breaker but adding one would overload the design or mean that signature parts would have to be left out. The handle is curved so it fits the hand and is easy to work with. On Amazon Prime Day, it was $10; an unbeatable value. The WOTOW stands on its own and is also a great partner to those who travel with a chain breaker. Bonus parts: three tire levers and a loose Allen key to adjust the connecting hinges.
customer_reviews.author: eddy haskel

customer_reviews.title: Just buy tools...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to do very basic work on my children's bikes. I tried to use it to adjust the training wheels on my son's bike right away. It was impossible to retighten the nut. This tool provides you with virtually no leverage, and even with leverage, the "wrench" tool simply pushes back into the tool if you try to tighten with it. It also keeps getting stuck on the nut. So esentially I bought this tool to make my job even harder. Just buy basic tools for your bike. Don't waste any money on these nonfunctional, crappy multitools
customer_reviews.author: K Asher

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-tool kit but a bit clunky
customer_reviews.text: The tool works great to fulfill its intended tasks. Each tool functions well and an extra hex wrench is included to tighten the screw holding them all together. I've used it several times now on my bike and I think this product is wonderful. The only thing is that it is a bit cumbersome. I would like to have such a tool on me when I am biking in case anything should go wrong, so its weight and size are a factor in that.
customer_reviews.author: MrAloha

customer_reviews.title: nice bike multitool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this multitool. Everything folds out nicely and feels tight/well-made, has a good selection of tools. Almost everything you need for an emergency repair (no chain tool though). The inclusion of some tire levers is a nice touch, although they feel like they may be a little flimsy. overall this tool is a good value for the money, and compares favorably to the more expensive brand-name multitool that I own.
customer_reviews.author: J E Kurz

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and a bit excessive but very usefull and effective!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but good product overall. Definitely has MORE than everything you would need. I have biked with it multiple times and have had no problems with it. It has been completely soaked multiple times and left to air dry... not the first sign of rust or corrosion. The picture I posted is after being covered in sweat and air dried multiple times..... It's a bit much for a biker as it comes with sockets, but hey you can change your car tire with it if necessary!...lol In all seriousness it's a great product for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: AB92

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is good
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't trust the 15mm wrench on it. There is not enough material or leverage to use that for removing a wheel or installing pedals. Everything else works great. I suggest using locktite on the threads of the pivoting retaining bolts. It has loosened over time like any tool of this design and needs a quality fix or the tool may come apart. Overall it is a good value and useful to keep around in an emergency bag.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Koelker

customer_reviews.title: More like multi-nonfunction tool. DO NOY BUY
customer_reviews.text: Man, my expectations were not high but this a terribly cheap, like bought from the car aisle at dollar tree. Nothing works and it breaks apart easy. I believe this is from a dollar store somewhere.. Save your money, thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: A.E

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool, Size/Weight May Be An Issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multi use bike tool, maybe a little too great. They have packed so many options into this little tool kit that I came quickly to the realization that it was a little bulky and 'weighty' as compared to a similar, much slimmer tool that I already have that contains only the essential hex wrenches and screw drivers (granted it didn't contain the integrated sockets this tool has but is there really much use for that in a portable tool?). It was a little awkard trying to maneuver the tool in tight places on the bike. I will keep the tool as a backup but I've retained my original 'slim' tool in my bike bag.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rashid

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool, really sturdy. It packs a lot into a small package. Some reviewers complain about the single loose Allen wrench saying that it is a poor design since it wasn’t attached to the tool itself. The loose Allen wrench is not part of the tool, it is there to tighten or loosen the bolt holding the individual wrenches / drivers in place on the tool housing itself. All in all, good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steven N. Hetzer

customer_reviews.title: Great toolkit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep in the bike bag of my new bike. It's always good to have some tools along if you need an adjustment. This evening I used the tool to remove my stock handlebars and install an upgrade. I needed 4 different Allan wrench sizes plus a screwdriver to complete the task. It was nice to have them all in one place. The tool worked well and was able to torque down the screws without an issue. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage! Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this piece of junk! This tool is garbage. My husband got a flat in the middle of the wood. He was 100% prepared for this kind of events having spare tubes, pump and this multi tool in his backpack. He tried to unscrew the wheel and this great multi tool bended. The screw was still at the same place. It is a joke. Things that are cheap are actually expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Great tire levers, indifferent multi-tool
customer_reviews.text: I mainly purchased this for the tire levers which worked perfectly. I thought the multitool might be useful, but due to the placement of the 10mm tool I couldn’t even remove a nut from the rear tire without the awkward multitool getting in the way. I would not use it over actual tools, but maybe a biker who travelled would find it useful to pack.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany N. White

customer_reviews.title: wrench sheared and hinge bent.
customer_reviews.text: 15mm solid wrench simply sheared around wheel nut and hinge bent started shearing as well. Worked fine for hex wrenches, some overall flexion of tool, but it did the job the few times i used it. Solid wrench failed on first use when out had to call AAA because this tool couldn't remove the wheelnuts so we couldn't fix the flat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Giving this five stars because the intent was to purchase a low cost tool. I’m sure there are better tools out there that are a little bit easier to open and close. This one does not come with a case which was a little annoying. However for the cost it is perfect and if you were looking for a better product, you should be spending more. In this price range, this is exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Ava411

customer_reviews.title: Best Tools Ever for Bikers
customer_reviews.text: I like my new tools for my long rides threw out the bike trails and this tools is one of the best things to have on you. I was riding with others one day and one of the other bikers had a problem with their bike. Someone pulls out this tool kit and fix their bike and we were on our way again. This company mail it out on time and I got it fast. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: PDove

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not fully usable.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent inexpensive multi-tool, but it is not fully functional. The 15mm wrench, which is the reason I purchased this specific item, is not really usable. It can't produce sufficient torque to remove a wheel nut (the main reason one might want such a thing, if one rides a SS or IGH. Other than that flaw, the tool seems reasonably well made, and useful. It is quite large, though not unexpected for the plurality of functions. One glaring omission, given this bulk, is a chain tool. It also only has one size of spoke wrench. I haven't tried the included tire levers, but they appear functional
customer_reviews.author: CPTJOHNC

customer_reviews.title: Only use it on bikes.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for my saddle bag. The addition of the sockets was a stroke of genius. While it's nice at times that all of the arms have free rotation, it can make get everything in place a pain at times. I do NOT recommend using this tool to break nuts, bolts or screws loose on anything but a bicycle or a small device. I could watch the entire tool warp while trying to break a bolt loose on a larger machine and just have to say it's not a Gerber or Leatherman and if you treat it like one you'll be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Clipped Wings

customer_reviews.title: Cheap I’d get the crank brothers multi tool but if you only want to spend $10 or less, get it
customer_reviews.text: I would give less stars if it didn’t come with the tire levers which have come in handy very much. The tool bent on my first use using the 15mm on it for my pedals to loosen on my new bike. Took an actual 15mm wrench to it and it was easy...no reason why it should bend the tool and it did. Also seems like it could come apart very easily
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rolla

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy this
customer_reviews.text: I didn't believe I have to buy a professional tool for bike until I met an installation issue. I tried every wrench in my tool box to secure a nut on my bike and failed. The size was not correct at all. This tiny tool solves the problem. In addition, I found that work great for a nut on my refrigerator handle last week.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Louie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compact tool for emergencies!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this compact little tool to carry in my bike pack for emergencies. It’s really solidly made and has every tool I can possibly need to make emergency repairs. Tried it out to install a water bottle carrier replace a seat on my bike and adjust the seat on my wife’s bike. Was able to really torque Allen nuts without any problems. Comes in a little ziplock pouch. Love my new tool! Do not hesitate to buy this tool! It’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Myron

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Levers
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this for the tire levers and they are great. The multitool, on the other hand, is a flimsy piece of garbage. I can’t even loosen a seat post bolt without it flexing and making cracking noises. I’d suggest investing in a steel tool that will survive more than 5 minutes of use, I threw this in the trash and kept the tire levers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Useful to have
customer_reviews.text: I like to ride my bike and this is a very useful little tool for that. It is well made, compact, and easy to store. It has everything on it you need for a quick adjustment or repair. Not much more can be said. The company shipped fast and checked to make sure it had arrived and I was satisfied. I am and frankly, you will be as well.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Petry

customer_reviews.title: Don't Lose the Unlocking Allen Wrench
customer_reviews.text: What if I lose the unlocking allen wrench? All the tools are locked tightly in place with the provided allen wrench. Only two major problems: 1) What happens if you lose the unlocking allen wrench? 2) Why didn't the manufacturer design a neat way to insert the locking wrench into the tool itself??? I like the design and tools feels solid. I'm making some adjustments to my 1985 Schwinn World tomorrow and hopefully I'll give you feedback on how the tools feels when being used. It seems like a nice tool. Just don't lose the unlocking allen wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Sine Nomine

customer_reviews.title: Buy this bike tool you wont regret it
customer_reviews.text: The value for this bike tool is great compared to the others. Its built sturdy to last long and it also has many other uses making it a versatile swiss army knife of sorts. Truly I am very satisfied with this purchase. The tool doesnt feel like a cheaply made one. It has heft to it all the more proving my point on why you should buy this one instead of risky ones.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted2Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool at a nice price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool because it packed all the things I needed to work on my road bike. First of all it came a day earlier inspite of the holiday weekend. I wasn't expecting it to be of any kind of good quality for the price I paid but it was surprisingly good quality and well built ofcourse for occational use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Chinese Product, but functional.
customer_reviews.text: It’s what you’d expect for a cheap Chinese product. It’ll function, but the machine work is sloppy and blemished. It came slightly bent due to mass quantities being stacked on top of each other without proper protective packing during overseas shipping. It’s surprisingly heavy though, so I’m hoping that’s an indication of them using decent steel in production.
customer_reviews.author: JToups386

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is not amazing quality, but it totally works. I’d say it’s better than the Bell brand I grabbed from Target and for the same price include tire levers. I’ve had to use both and they have worked great. Only potential issue is the tool is a little wide, might not fit if you have a really small bag, but it wasn’t and issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Cole

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tools that do what they’re supposed to. The only issue I have is that the width of the tool is substantial enough that I can’t use the tool easily in the smaller spaces on my road bike. I have to continually lift and place the tool heads when turning as the base is big enough that it blocks the ability to continuously turn the tool the way I can with a single Allen wrench. I do have a small frame, though, and it works fine on brake calipers or seat posts that are more open. Just tight when adjusting derailleurs.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Probably just my pack that was missing a tool to make this tool stable to use
customer_reviews.text: Not very easy to use. It said you can tighten with an Allen wrench but none of the ones I have fits the tool. I think my pack was missing the Allen wrench thing that was suppose to come with it. It gets loose and wobbly when you try to unscrew or screw something and takes a lot more work since it’s not stable.
customer_reviews.author: Lillymama

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool
customer_reviews.text: Great all around tool! I consider this to be my go to essential tool when we are out in the middle of no where on our Mountain Bikes. Has 6 Allen keys from 2 to 6mm, Phillips and straight screwdriver, 8, 9, 10mm sockets with squared driver and flip out plate with spoke, 8, 10 and 15mm wrenches. This is going to cover a lot of your needs out on the trail. This with a Combi-tool..Unstoppable. If you don’t have one in your kit ...get it now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thorn

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 bikes and have used it for several things already.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 bikes and have already used the tool several time to make adjustments, etc. It seems well built and I'm sure it will save me several times in the future. Very convenient to have most or all of the tools I should need to make adjustments or install new accessories all in the same place.
customer_reviews.author: Larc

customer_reviews.title: Multi-Function is Right!
customer_reviews.text: Though it turns out I don't need this product for my new bike, it's so handy for my older one. All around, it's a neat kit to have around for more than just a bike. This seller doesn't offer free returns so I'd recommend you being sure that this is the right tool set for you. I, myself, would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KMNY

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap, works fine, but won't take a wheel off.
customer_reviews.text: This thing came with absolutely every tool I needed to work on my bike. It can be a bit annoying to use some of them, but you can do it. The only thing this CAN'T do is take off a wheel (that's bolted on, not the quick release kind). It's got a 15mm wrench, but it's nowhere near strong enough, or with enough leverage, to get the wheel off. Construction is kinda cheap, but good enough that you can't break it very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I bought this for the plastic tire tools but I ended up going to the LBS to have my tires put on. I kept this multi-wrench tool though as the allen wrenches and screwdrivers are good. I keep it in my bike bag. The tool is nice and stiff and the allen wrenches don't flop all over. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Handy but too big for a folding bike
customer_reviews.text: I have a compact folding bike, so the tool doesn’t fit in the small spaces. I took it apart - broke it into two sections, so that I can use it better and get more leverage in the hard to reach spots. Will update my review when I have to use it for more than just break pad adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Nice little toolkit to get me out of a jam ...
customer_reviews.text: A Nice little toolkit to get me out of a jam if I need it. Not at all ideal for regular maintenance. The only downside now is, I have to buy a pack of some sort to store it in when I ride. And, it might get ripped off at the grocery store...fortunately, it's inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: OldProChefTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have along
customer_reviews.text: Not a single negative thing to say. Happily I haven’t had the need to use it yet so I can’t comment on the quality or durability but it fits nicely in my under seat pouch and gives me a measure of peace of mind to know I’m less liable to be stuck somewhere for lack of the right tool.
customer_reviews.author: kwilding

customer_reviews.title: Tire levers worthless
customer_reviews.text: Took the tool out of the package and two of the tire levers snapped in half right away trying to change a tire. Not sure why they are included, they are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Cakester Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy to carry around on your bike
customer_reviews.text: Tool seems well built and solid. The big problem I have with it is it's quite heavy for a portable bike tool. I'm not trying to add this much weight to my bike and riding gear. It has a lot of tools that you'll never need for a roadside fix, all of which comes with the price of added weight. I returned mine.
customer_reviews.author: Gila Monster

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: My daughter gave me this for a Christmas present. Not a bad little tool to have with you. I do not have another to compare it with but for the couple of times I have used it, it has functioned well. For me it is an emergency tool to carry in my pack in case of a break down.
customer_reviews.author: Hollywood

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: So one thing I would like to point out is the fact that they send this out with an external allen key to keep the entire multi tool together. I once bought a multi-tool and after using it for 5 minutes it came loose and fell apart and of course I did not have an allen key to put it back together. Other than that I find the tool to work fantastic so far. It will forever sit in my waist bag to use while on the trails.
customer_reviews.author: dustin johnson

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good tool
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived today, on first impression it seems solidly built. Tire levers seem standard. It comes with an extra Allen wrench to tighten the hinges. Only complaint is that there is a bit of duplication; there are sockets for 8 and 10 mm but those sizes are also included on the wrench pull out. Seems like a missed opportunity to either cut weight or add different options. Pretty minor complaint though, will definitely have this in my saddle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not the Best for BMXs
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this does come with quite a jnice set of tools. Although, if you're riding a BMX of some sort this may not be the best. As I mainly ride a BMX bike and once this came in. I was hoping to be able to just use it straight away but none of the tools fit the screws or bolts on my bike. For reference, my bike is the 2019 Kink Whip XL. Also the handle is plastic and bends quite easily under slight pressure. Which isn't a good thing especially when you havr tight bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Sely

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Nice to throw into the pouch and have for roadside repairs when needed. Quality is OK. I doubt it would hold up to any real torque, but it works. The tire wedges things are nice and are better than a set that came with another thing I bought. At least for a road bike.
customer_reviews.author: James Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I've used the tool and tire lever a few times now - and it has been great. Very handy and easy to use - just don't let any of the wrenches slip and you shouldn't have an issue with minor repairs (it's not intended to be the primary repair tool). Wish this one came with a case.
customer_reviews.author: Jamming-Cool

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy, ask yourself this question...............
customer_reviews.text: Before buying, ask yourself “Is saving $20 worth hiking 10 miles out of a trail simply because you didn't have the basic tools? If you answered yes this is the tool for you! On the merits of the tool alone it’s a reasonably well designed and functioning tool. However, on the basis in which its marketed (a bike tool), it leaves a great deal to be desired. It’s missing a number of the key tools one would expect in this heavy and hefty solution. Need a biketool? Looks elsewhere. Spend some more and buy a Crank Brothers 19.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great choice so far
customer_reviews.text: This is the first and only multi tool I've ever had, but I've made quite a few adjustments to my kid's bike and my own and it worked like a charm. I really like the extra allen included to loosen and tighten the tool itself. Haven't had a need to use the tire wrenches yet but they look pretty standard. So in all a great product at a good price
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie E. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: WOTOW WoW!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for an all in one tool for my bike. I have most of the tools on the WOTOW, but they are all loose and take up a lot of room in my small bike tool case. This is Perfect I have a lot more room and I don't hear all that clanking of the loose tools hitting when I ride my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ade's Kites (not just kites)

customer_reviews.title: Good bike tool
customer_reviews.text: I got this for future issues with my kids’ bikes but all I’ve done so far is use it to tighten them up. The tool is easy to use and a good value. It’s fairly small and you could carry with you in a backpack or bicycle pouch if you’re into biking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This little tool kit packs a lot at a value price...the tire changing sticks are a little on the small size but they can do the job. Like all multiple functions tools the WOTW tool can be a little awkward at times but loose tools carried in a bag can be lost and you won't notice it until you are pedaling down the road. Throw the WOTOW 16 in 1 tool in your pack along with a pump and spare innertube and your set for most problems encountered during everyday road or mountain biking.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Ray Woods

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great multi-tool to throw in your pack with your spare tubes. It’s got the tools to get the job done out on the road/trail to a “good enough” standard to at least let you get home. It’s also small enough to go in even very small bags. I keep it with me every time I ride. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but a little too much for me.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but a little heavy and bulky for my needs. I like the cheap one my husband got from the hardware store better for me. This one has more than I need and I prefer longe tools for more leverage and narrower to fit in smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars All Around!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool it has everything I need for my bike - it’s a normal cruiser bike not sure how it would work with people that exercise regularly or use bikes professionally but for the everyday user it works out great! Very well built sturdy compact and handy.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great item, great price
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on Amazon Prime. I have 3 current bicycles, each with a seat/tool bag. In each is a spare tube, tire changing tools and a few other tools. The WowTow 16 has everything but the tube and fits in my stuffed seat bags without a problem. And with it I have more tools there than I'm accustomed to traveling with (unless I'm on a long trip where I carry a bigger 'tool' kit). Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a find!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe that this product is not sold in bike shops - it is awesome! It is very sturdy and compact and fits nicely in my saddlebag. It also comes with the levers for tire removal. This is a wonderful tool - like having a toolbox under the seat.
customer_reviews.author: HeyCath

customer_reviews.title: does everything but grill up your post-ride hamburgers
customer_reviews.text: This marvelously versatile and well-conceived tool is perfect for small to medium adjustments at home and even as an on-ride security blanket for those who fear the worst when the wheels are rolling. An added touch is the inclusion of an Allen wrench for keeping the tool itself tightly wound. You'll still need your bike shop. Just not as much.
customer_reviews.author: David A. BaerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy Tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my city bike that has a 15mm bolt on the wheels. I didn't want to be stranded if i got a flat, so picked this up. The first time I tried to use the 15mm wrench the metal bent and it was impossible to get enough leverage to actually get the bolt off. If you just need it for the allen wrenches you're probably fine, but if you need it for bolts, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: T. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: glad I discovered so immediately
customer_reviews.text: poorly constructed item, glad I discovered so immediately. I needed to remove my tire, so I pulled out the solid wrench tool and used the 15mm slot. The tool bent back the other way because the supporting component within the handle wasn't strong enough to handle the force. This tool is a joke, don't buy it. I was cheap. My mistake. I used to own an Alien II from Topeak, but lost it. That was a well-constructed tool.
customer_reviews.author: J.B. Millerton

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: Product came on time. Nice small and compact. Used some of the tool right out the back. If you need something small and compact to make minor adjustments to your bicycle I highly recommend this item. Wouldn’t use it to put a bike together or any major repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Decent tools
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's worth keeping in a storage pouch on your bike incase you need a quick fix on the trails. Most of the wrenches fit on my Schwinn Sidewinder, however, the metal and plastic mount flexed when I really needed to loosen a tough bolt. This showed how crappy the quality was made when I really needed it. It flexed a lot but I wouldn't imagine it lasting very long after a few tough bolts that need to be loosened. I'd recommend this tool as a back up that you keep with you on bike rides.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great overall bike tool
customer_reviews.text: I still have this bike tool, and it will set you up to fix most problems you’ll run into while at home or out and about on your bicycle. Multiple size Allen wrench, philips and flathead screwdrivers, even comes with tire levers. Would recommend definitely
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not super high quality...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an emergency use tool set. It's ok....doesn't appear to be sturdy, and worried that the hex keys do not have a tight enough tolerance and will round-over. Might be a "one and done" set, but that's what I bought it for. The size and weight are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: WOTOW 16 in 1 Multi-Function Bike Bicycle Cycling Mechanic Repair Tool Kit
customer_reviews.text: I love this multi function tool and it came with three tire levers. The hex keys are chrome plated steel, has screw driver, 3 hex drivers, a spoke tightener, and more all in a small package. I used it a few days ago and find it very useful. I now have two different brands of this type of multi tool, I like this one the best as it has the most functions and it still can get into tight areas on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Came with two 4mm allen keys instead of a 4mm and a 5mm, as was stated in the description. I didn't need to use it until after the return window closed so I'm out the money for it. Very poor quality control to let that one slip by. My bike only requires a 5mm allen key so this tool is mostly useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy. Tools do not stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to keep this in my bike bag in case of emergencies but was severely disappointed when none of the tools stayed in place. The entire piece itself just felt very flimsy despite the weight.
customer_reviews.author: RVS

customer_reviews.title: but too bad the tire bars don't clip to the main body ...
customer_reviews.text: It's got what you need, but too bad the tire bars don't clip to the main body somehow, as that kind of defeats the "multi-TOOL" aspect. Also, not sure what the extra Allen key is for. Again, it's just loose and will float around. Plus there's one the same size in the tool. Maybe there are some things where you wouldn't be able to fit the multi-tool, but they should have integrated a way to fit the separate key and unitize it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Waldmann

customer_reviews.title: The plastic casing broke after about 50 weeks.  But it was great while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY like this mirror. It was so practical to use and adjust. However, the process of adjusting it and readjusting it every so often weakened the the plastic enclosure where the screws go causing it to crack and, eventually, it fell off. It was perfect, though, while it lasted. I'm now looking for a more robust mirror. I wish I could buy the same one again.
customer_reviews.author: Ipecacuana

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my brother-in-law. It was just a little something I had gotten him for Christmas. He is a Big bicycler, many miles a day. He had something similar but lost it over a year ago, he loves it and is much better and higher quality than the one he had previously.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Such a versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike tool/multi tool bases of the ratings, price, and as a lightning deal. All I can say is wow!!! I used this tool to assemble 2 Schwinn bikes I bought from Walmart and the only other tool I need was a crescent wrench. I completely adjusted the brakes and cables on the bikes with no other tools required. Every accessory I have added to the bikes, this tool does it all. Anyone who owns a bike should have this with them as it is a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The 15 mm slot is pretty useless. I tried to use it to take ...
customer_reviews.text: The 15 mm slot is pretty useless. I tried to use it to take out a pedal to switch them out since my adjustable wrench and open end wrench wouldn't fit and it just bent. I was hoping to keep it on my bike for emergencies mostly just for the 15 mm but it's way too heavy to carry it and a small wrench. The Allen keys are fine for adjustments at home.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why there is a loose allen wrench. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why there is a loose allen wrench. The quality of the metal is a bit soft so be careful you don't strip anything, ie hexes. In retrospect I wish that I bought a multi with a chain breaker because chain failures are far more common than you might think. The levers seem to be adequate for wire beads but if you have to deal with kevlar you might want a thicker, stronger set.
customer_reviews.author: RogerDodger

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly Used it on Car
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bike. I didn't even use for installation because I found my old one. But I did end up using it when replacing my car's battery! I'm so happy it had the tools I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Android 006

customer_reviews.title: this tool is a great value.
customer_reviews.text: You've got to stash those tire tools in a bag separately, as they aren't an integral part of the tool itself. But that's not a deal killer. This rig has most of what you need and will want. All in all, this tool is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Soon as I got it I stuck it in my bag. Just so happened that while I was riding my handlebars needed tightening. Tool worked great. It's sturdy (even have an Allen wrench to tighten it if it loosens) and well made. Doesn't come with a case so I'm probably gonna make a small bag to keep it in. If your looking to keep your bike up and running while on the go... this tool is perfect. If your looking into opening up your own repair shop... keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a new beach cruiser. It was assembled for me, and I later learned the seat was too low. Not only was this item perfect for saving me a trip back to the bike shop, by raising the seat myself, but I now also have any tool I might need for future use. I leave it in my bike basket during rides, “just in case”. Great price & purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DMY

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest quality or most useful tool in the world
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this tool. I think for the price, there are better ones out there that do a much better job. It's easy to use, but it was pricey for what it offers. You can probably get a set elsewhere for a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: George Odisho

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I like this "little" tool, so much so that I purchased a second one. While they aren't the smallest tool, it has everything I need in one spot and fits nicely in my pack. It's come in quite handy and proven itself on more than one occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but usable multi tool.
customer_reviews.text: Has everything you need to fix up your bike. Really satisfied that they even included things to take off your tire. For the price its really the only choice. Other multi tool in this price range have bad reviews, so I bought this one. Its great and can be easily stored in pretty much any size bag that you might attach to your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small compact and great for simple road repairs
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I could do simple adjustments on the road. The tire levers are also great for the tires on my bike trailer. They are also useful for opening a soda can tab. Got it a few days ago and used it three times already.
customer_reviews.author: SP BisbeeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Essential purchase for every mountain biker
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I didn't expect much for the price, but wow. Every mountain biker should own this. Solid construction, every tool you need, and great quality. I cannot believe the the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jake L

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: I actually made this purchase for the tire tools but the multi tool is a great bonus. I have a somewhat similar Park tool and this one seems to have everything the Park one does. And they are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: M/W

customer_reviews.title: They thought of Everything
customer_reviews.text: Fits intuitively in the hand for all of it's functions and is strong in it's construction's design. The tool assortment is well-chosen and the mechanics of the co-operative tools and dual use allen heads is very well thought out. A bike guy did this design concept and it shows well in the final product. How they can make it for this price remains a mystery to me, Good Tool with a great arrangement.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Kirwan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, small and handy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, nice weight, handy tool to have for kids scooters, skateboards, general things. Many tools, I have used them all, but I just used the screwdriver tool and it was stiff, which was good. I didn't want a multi-tool that was going to swing out its instruments very easily. Came in a nice storage pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Bradshaw

product_meta.title: WOTOW 16 in 1 Multi-Function Bike Bicycle Cycling Mechanic Repair Tool Kit with 3 pcs Tire Pry Bars Rods
feature_bullets: It can help you fix most Problems of Your Bike With This Kit
With good quality, durable, full function
16 function all in one tool:Socket Hex Wrench 8/9/10/mm,Slotted Screwdriver,Phillips Screwdriver,Socket Extension Rod,Solid Wrench 8/10/15/mm,Hex Key Wrench 2/2.5/3/4/5/6mm,Spoke Wrench;
3 pcs Nylon pry tire rods, Ideal Thanksgiving and Christmas Gift for Cyclists

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
